p: The surface potential of FeNPs was detected using the zeta potential method, which is a fundamental characterization tool to distinguish the stability of NPs in an aqueous solution. As depicted in Figure 8(a), the zeta potential of Fe 3O 4-NPs is -35 mV (at a range of -10 to -45 mV), demonstrating that the synthesized NPs are highly stable due to their strong negative surface charge [ 61]. The distribution size of the synthesized FeNPs was determined by PSA. As shown in Figure 8(b), an average size of 9.2 nm was obtained for the NPs synthesized in this experiment. The crystalline size of FeNPs calculated from PSA was further counterverified using XRD and FE-SEM methods.
